subject: Re: [junit] No tests error......
msgSnippet: ... More specifically, you must have at least one public void method whose name begins with test . The JUnit test runners use reflection to find the test
messageBody:
Simon Chappell wrote:
> The best way to get past this error message is to write at least one test. :-)

More specifically, you must have at least one public void method whose
name begins with "test". The JUnit test runners use reflection to find
the test methods, and the "test" prefix is how they distinguish them
from other, non-test methods (such as setUp() and tearDown()).

> On 2/26/06, Srikumar Krishna Iyer <physri@...> wrote:
>
>>hello guys,
>>
>>i am posting this only after going through the faqs
>>
>>i am getting the following error,
>>
>>help me out,
>>
>>There was 1 failure:
>>1) warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError:
>>No tests found in TestLogin
>>bye
